titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 21) to designate certain lands in the California Desert as wilderness, to establish Death Valley, Joshua Tree, and Mojave National Parks, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-839, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to S. 21. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Immediately upon adoption of this rule the House shall consider the conference report accompanying S. 21, and all points of order against the conference report and against its consideration shall be waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 243.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 242 - 140 (Roll no. 501).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/5/1994--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report to accompany S. 21 (Death Valley, Joshua Tree, and Mojave National Parks).
